alert.note: Alert for Spencer; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 12:52AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Indiana, including the following areas, Spencer and Warrick. * WHEN...Until 130 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1150 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated between 2 and 3 inches of rain had fallen due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - While the heaviest rain has moved out the area, it will take some time for any lingering flooding to recede. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Evansville, Boonville, Newburgh, Chandler, Rockport, Dale, Grandview, Folsomville, Santa Claus, Eureka, Chrisney, Tennyson and Gentryville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
